TopicTitle: Do It Like Jebediah: Orbit and land safely using only boosters

Articles.Content:
Alright people. Your task is simple:

[list type=decimal]

[li]Get into space[/li]

[li]Orbit[/li]

[li]Land safely (anywhere)

[/li]

But you have execute it like Jeb would: Boosters, boosters, boosters. No sissy stuff like parachutes or liquid engines. Nova and Sunday Punch's part packs are allowable, but the real Thrillmaster would do it with the stock boosters. 8)

Good luck.
My kinda challenge. 8)

For added bonus points, try and do it in a *single* stack, without lateral decouplers or surface-mounts! (For that purpose, I'd also permit the various multi-couplers in Sunday Punch's pack, and the lateral bi- and tri-couplers.)

I'm not sure that's even possible to do, but it'd certainly be an interesting twist.

Yeah , the stock wings just don't have enough lift. I've been experimenting with C7s aviation mod though and have come up with a number of prototypes that show some promise. The latest is the Jebediah 1.2 , which is effectively a C30 solid booster with a delta wing , wing let-tail and some landing gear bolted on. So far its proven pretty safe , the bouncy gear surviving landing speeds of up to 50 m/s. The only problem I have found has actually been stopping , as a glitch in the part physics seems to mean that the craft only de-accelerates very slowly on the ground , and has a tendency to bounce. My solution in the .2 model was to attach the gear to radial decouplers so that once the machine had bounced its way down to 20m/s or so I can blast off the wheels and drop onto the 'belly' of the booster , which naturally pulls up pretty sharp. Success rate after a bit of practice is above 80% , so now im moving on to build a launcher to try and put this contraption in orbit.
